intro: Sinomalus fusca, commonly known as the black-eyed Susan, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounding a dark central disk, giving it its common name. It typically grows in open areas such as meadows and prairies. Sinomalus fusca is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
